title: Having troubles connecting all 5 members at a lan party
body:
We have 5 guys in a basement, we're all hooked to the same router, have the same default gateway, have valid IP addresses and can play other games (we had 4 in destiny while waiting for a fifth) the fifth shows up and when we set up he can log in and view loot/store etc. Client looks ok, but he can't see game invites from us.

The 4 of us see a lobby with 4 players loaded and that he has a pending invite but he doesn't see the invite. 
One time the lobby leader swapped game type to blind pick then back to draft and this at least synced up enough to the point that we could invite him, when we got to Champ select the 5th guy couldn't lock in and nothing has allowed him to see a game invite since. 

Doesn't seem to be a common issue so I was wondering if there was something configuration side we could check for or what else info wise we'd need to know.
Thanks!

replies.body:
Aw wow, I'm insanely jealous of this LAN and it sucks that a friend is getting left out.  :(  Your network might be having some issues, or more specifically, your friend's computer might be.  For example, if you trying logging on that pc do you then get left out?  

Try downloading [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) on the impacted PC and use it to auto-configure firewall settings.  That may help clear up any blocks.

If that doesn't help, your best bet would be to run through the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help clear things up.
